item_description: Professional attendance (other than a service to which another item applies) at a residential aged care facility (racf) or consulting rooms, for an obvious problem characterised by the straightforward nature of the task.
rationale: The note describes a 11-year-old child presenting after a bicycle accident with concussion and minor injuries, with management limited to reassurance and education. There is no mention of a residential aged care facility or consulting rooms. The setting and clinical context do not align with the item's requirement of attendance at a racf or consulting rooms for an obvious problem in an aged care context.
citations: Patient 11 years old with history of bicycle accident involving head and leg impact, with brief loss of consciousness.
Presented with headache and leg pain; no significant back pain.
Management: Reassurance, education on short-term and long-term effects of concussion; advice to return to ED if concerns arise in next 24-48 hours.
